description: Subsequences of [ 1,...,2n+1 ] in which each even number has an odd neighbor.
comments: Same as Pisot sequence E(2,7)8*A007484(n) = A007482(n+2) + A007483(n+1) (conjectured, see A104934 for related formula) - _Creighton Dement_, Apr 15 2005A007484(n) = total of the elements of the matrix {{1, 2}, {2, 2}} raised to the nth power - _Griffin N. Macris_, Mar 25 2016
references: R. K. Guy, Moser, William O.J.: Numbers of subsequences without isolated odd members. Fibonacci Quarterly, 34, No. 2, 152-155 (1996).
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (3, 2).
formula: a(n) = 3a(n-1) + 2a(n-2).a(n)=[3/2+(1/2)*sqrt(17)]^n-(4/17)*sqrt(17)*[3/2-(1/2)*sqrt(17)]^n+(4/17)*[3/2+(1/2) *sqrt(17)]^n*sqrt(17)+[3/2-(1/2)*sqrt(17)]^n, with n>=0 - _Paolo P. Lava_, Jun 11 2008If p[i]=fibonacci(i+2) and if A is the Hessenberg matrix of order n defined by: A[i,j]=p[j-i+1], (i<=j), A[i,j]=-1, (i=j+1), and A[i,j]=0 otherwise. Then, for n>=1, a(n-1)= det A. - _Milan Janjic_, May 08 2010
maple: A007484 := proc(n) option remember; if n=0 then 2; elif n=1 then 7; else 3*A007484(n-1)+2*A007484(n-2); fi; end;
prog: (Haskell)a007484 n = a007484_list !! na007484_list = 2 : 7 : zipWith (+)               (map (* 3) $ tail a007484_list) (map (* 2) a007484_list)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 02 2015(PARI) a(n)=([0,1; 2,3]^n*[2;7])[1,1] \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 25 2016
